CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 25, 1954, pg. 13, reads: "WILY Interview - One hundred and seven year old Mrs. Sabra Washington of 8125 Conemaugh Street, is one of the many interesting Pittsburgh personalities who will be interviewed on Bill Powell's newly acquired radio station WILY in near future. Here Mrs. Earsley Kincaid and Lee Dorris, announcers on WILY, rehearse the aged Mrs. Washington in preparation for her radio date. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Earsley Kincaid and Lee Doris holding WILY radio station microphone, posed on either side of former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington, in her home on Conemaugh Street
